title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0150

segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome back to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎回到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: And my name is Katherine.
segments.cn: 我叫Katherine。

segments.en: And today we're talking about one of my least favorite things, Marco.
segments.cn: 今天我们要谈论我最不喜欢的事情之一，Marco。

segments.en: Mosquitoes.
segments.cn: 蚊子。

segments.en: Mosquitoes.
segments.cn: 蚊子。

segments.en: They're all over the place, especially in summer or near water.
segments.cn: 它们到处都是，尤其是在夏天或水边。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And for me, the worst part is when you are trying to sleep and there's a mosquito that just keeps on biting you and won't let you sleep.
segments.cn: 对我来说，最糟糕的部分是当你试图入睡时，有一只蚊子不停地叮你，让你无法入睡。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是啊。

segments.en: You can kind of hear it around your head, you know, by your ears.
segments.cn: 你能听到它在你头边飞，知道吗，在你耳边。

segments.en: Oh, I hate that.
segments.cn: 哦，我讨厌那样。

segments.en: Or when you just get bitten and you're in bed and it just itches so much.
segments.cn: 或者当你刚被叮到，躺在床上，痒得厉害。

segments.en: And it burns sometimes.
segments.cn: 有时还会烧。

segments.en: Yeah, so that's what we're talking about today.
segments.cn: 是的，这就是我们今天要谈论的。

segments.en: Fun stuff.
segments.cn: 有趣的事情。

segments.en: Let's jump right into this dialogue and we'll be back in a minute to talk about what's going on.
segments.cn: 让我们直接进入对话，稍后我们会回来谈谈发生了什么。

segments.en: The mosquitoes are biting me.
segments.cn: 蚊子在叮我。

segments.en: Me too.
segments.cn: 我也是。

segments.en: I can't stop scratching.
segments.cn: 我忍不住抓。

segments.en: They're everywhere, sneaky little jerks.
segments.cn: 它们到处都是，狡猾的小家伙。

segments.en: Do you have any bug spray?
segments.cn: 你有驱虫喷雾吗？

segments.en: No, I forgot to buy some.
segments.cn: 没有，我忘了买。

segments.en: Then we'll have to put up with it.
segments.cn: 那我们就得忍受了。

segments.en: We can cover ourselves with beer.
segments.cn: 我们可以用啤酒涂自己。

segments.en: That way if they bite us, they'll get drunk and fall asleep.
segments.cn: 这样如果它们叮我们，它们会喝醉然后睡着。

segments.en: That's without doubt the best idea you've ever had.
segments.cn: 这无疑是你有过的最好主意。

segments.en: Let's do it.
segments.cn: 我们来试试。

segments.en: Run, they're thirsty for more.
segments.cn: 快跑，它们渴望更多。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So let's take a look at some of these words in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看一些语言要点。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言要点。

segments.en: All right, so as we mentioned, we're going to be talking about mosquitoes.
segments.cn: 好的，正如我们提到的，我们要谈论蚊子。

segments.en: And well, these are just little small insects that suck your blood.
segments.cn: 这些只是小小的昆虫，吸你的血。

segments.en: They do.
segments.cn: 它们确实如此。

segments.en: And they're very thin and not much to say about them.
segments.cn: 它们非常纤细，没什么好说的。

segments.en: They were very important in the movie Jurassic Park, if you remember that.
segments.cn: 在电影《侏罗纪公园》中它们非常重要，如果你还记得的话。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Now, what's the difference between a mosquito and a fly?
segments.cn: 那么，蚊子和苍蝇有什么区别？

segments.en: OK, a fly usually is just annoying.
segments.cn: 好吧，苍蝇通常只是烦人。

segments.en: It doesn't suck your blood, but a mosquito does.
segments.cn: 它不吸你的血，但蚊子会。

segments.en: It sucks your blood and flies are fatter and like shorter.
segments.cn: 它吸你的血，而苍蝇则更胖，个子更矮。

segments.en: And they're big and black and they're green kind of some black and green.
segments.cn: 它们大而黑，有些是黑色和绿色的。

segments.en: And they yeah, they just buzz around.
segments.cn: 它们在周围嗡嗡作响。

segments.en: So mosquitoes actually bite you.
segments.cn: 所以蚊子实际上会叮你。

segments.en: OK, so a mosquito and they fly.
segments.cn: 好吧，蚊子和苍蝇。

segments.en: Now, if a mosquito bites you, you really, really want to scratch.
segments.cn: 现在，如果蚊子叮你，你真的很想抓。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So you feel like you need to scratch your body because you have this bite.
segments.cn: 所以你会觉得需要抓你的身体，因为你有这个叮咬。

segments.en: You're you know, it's really an allergy and you have a red bump on your arm, a red Mark and you scratch and it gets worse and worse.
segments.cn: 你知道，这实际上是一种过敏，你的手臂上有一个红肿，红点，你抓它，情况会越来越糟。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And moving on to our next word, mosquitoes have a reputation of being sneaky.
segments.cn: 接下来，蚊子有狡猾的名声。

segments.en: OK, so you can say sneaky about a lot of things.
segments.cn: 好吧，你可以用“狡猾”来形容很多东西。

segments.en: One, you know, obviously we're saying mosquitoes are very sneaky.
segments.cn: 首先，显然我们说蚊子非常狡猾。

segments.en: That means that they can kind of hide and get you when you're not expecting it.
segments.cn: 这意味着它们可以躲藏，在你没有预料到的时候叮你。

segments.en: Yeah, because sometimes during the day, you don't really see them in your room, right?
segments.cn: 是的，因为有时在白天，你在房间里并不真的看到它们，对吧？

segments.en: They're hiding or they're in a place where you can't really see them.
segments.cn: 它们躲藏，或者在你看不见的地方。

segments.en: And then at night, all of a sudden they come out.
segments.cn: 然后在晚上，突然它们就出来了。

segments.en: They come out.
segments.cn: 它们出来了。

segments.en: So and they're very hard to see.
segments.cn: 而且它们很难被看到。

segments.en: They fly around in a way that's very difficult to catch them or kill them, right?
segments.cn: 它们飞的方式很难抓住或杀死它们，对吧？

segments.en: Right, we could say thieves are very sneaky.
segments.cn: 对，我们可以说小偷非常狡猾。

segments.en: Like a thief is someone who steals something and they like to sneak around and hide in the dark.
segments.cn: 小偷是偷东西的人，他们喜欢在黑暗中潜行和躲藏。

segments.en: And then when you're not expecting it, they come out and they steal your your stuff.
segments.cn: 然后当你没有预料到的时候，他们就出来偷你的东西。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: And now what do we what do we do or what do we use in order to prevent mosquitoes from biting us?
segments.cn: 现在我们该怎么做，或者我们用什么来防止蚊子叮我们？

segments.en: This is essential, especially if you're going to the beach.
segments.cn: 这很重要，尤其是如果你要去海滩。

segments.en: We bring bug spray.
segments.cn: 我们带驱虫喷雾。

segments.en: Bug spray.
segments.cn: 驱虫喷雾。

segments.en: So a spray is something that that you can usually have in a can that you push a button and it comes out.
segments.cn: 所以喷雾是你通常可以在罐子里拥有的东西，你按一个按钮就会喷出来。

segments.en: All right, right.
segments.cn: 好的，没错。

segments.en: It's like it's like water, but it keeps the bugs away.
segments.cn: 它就像水，但可以驱赶昆虫。

segments.en: So bug spray keeps bugs away, not only mosquitoes, but like flies, too flies or any other type of bug.
segments.cn: 所以驱虫喷雾可以驱赶昆虫，不仅是蚊子，还有苍蝇或其他类型的昆虫。

segments.en: Now, specifically for mosquitoes, you would use maybe a mosquito repellent, right?
segments.cn: 现在，专门针对蚊子，你可能会使用蚊子驱避剂，对吧？

segments.en: So repellent is a it means something that pushes or keeps away things you don't want.
segments.cn: 所以驱避剂是指推开或保持远离你不想要的东西。

segments.en: So something that keeps mosquitoes away is called a mosquito repellent.
segments.cn: 所以保持蚊子远离的东西叫做蚊子驱避剂。

segments.en: And usually it's a cream you put on your arms or legs.
segments.cn: 通常它是一种涂在手臂或腿上的乳膏。

segments.en: All right, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: So interesting words that we've just taken a look at.
segments.cn: 我们刚刚看过的一些有趣的词。

segments.en: Let's listen to our dialogue again.
segments.cn: 让我们再听一次对话。

segments.en: And we'll be right back.
segments.cn: 我们马上回来。

segments.en: The mosquitoes are biting me.
segments.cn: 蚊子在叮我。

segments.en: Me too.
segments.cn: 我也是。

segments.en: I can't stop scratching.
segments.cn: 我忍不住抓。

segments.en: They're everywhere.
segments.cn: 它们到处都是。

segments.en: Sneaky little jerks.
segments.cn: 狡猾的小家伙。

segments.en: Do you have any bug spray?
segments.cn: 你有驱虫喷雾吗？

segments.en: No, I forgot to buy some.
segments.cn: 没有，我忘了买。

segments.en: Then we'll have to put up with it.
segments.cn: 那我们就得忍受了。

segments.en: We can cover ourselves with beer.
segments.cn: 我们可以用啤酒涂自己。

segments.en: That way, if they bite us, they'll get drunk and fall asleep.
segments.cn: 这样，如果它们叮我们，它们会喝醉然后睡着。

segments.en: That's without doubt, the best idea you've ever had.
segments.cn: 这无疑是你有过的最好主意。

segments.en: Let's do it.
segments.cn: 我们来试试。

segments.en: Run.
segments.cn: 快跑。

segments.en: They're thirsty for more.
segments.cn: 它们渴望更多。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now let's take a look at a couple of different phrases on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看流利构建器上的几个不同短语。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 流利构建器。

segments.en: All right, so the first phrase is very, very common.
segments.cn: 好的，第一个短语非常非常常见。

segments.en: The person in the dialogue says that they're going to have to put up with it, put up with these mosquitoes because they didn't have any bug spray.
segments.cn: 对话中的人说他们将不得不忍受这些蚊子，因为他们没有驱虫喷雾。

segments.en: So this phrase to put up with is really important.
segments.cn: 所以这个短语“忍受”非常重要。

segments.en: All right, so if you put up with something, it means that you tolerate it.
segments.cn: 好的，如果你忍受某事，意味着你容忍它。

segments.en: All right, that means even if you don't want to, you'll still handle it.
segments.cn: 这意味着即使你不想，你仍然会处理它。

segments.en: You'll still have to deal with it.
segments.cn: 你仍然必须面对它。

segments.en: You accept it.
segments.cn: 你接受它。

segments.en: So maybe you have a little brother that's very annoying and you just have to put up with him.
segments.cn: 所以也许你有一个非常烦人的弟弟，你只能忍受他。

segments.en: There's no other option.
segments.cn: 没有其他选择。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Or someone says to you, you're just going to have to put up with it.
segments.cn: 或者有人对你说，你只能忍受它。

segments.en: Or you say, I won't put up with it anymore.
segments.cn: 或者你说，我再也忍受不了了。

segments.en: I won't handle this anymore.
segments.cn: 我不想再处理这个了。

segments.en: I'm done.
segments.cn: 我受够了。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So I think this is a great phrase for us to take a look at a couple of different examples.
segments.cn: 我认为这是一个很好的短语，我们可以看看几个不同的例子。

segments.en: Example one.
segments.cn: 例子一。

segments.en: I can't put up with the noise any longer.
segments.cn: 我再也忍受不了噪音了。

segments.en: Turn that music down.
segments.cn: 把音乐调小。

segments.en: Example two.
segments.cn: 例子二。

segments.en: If you can put up with the smell, then stinky tofu is actually very tasty.
segments.cn: 如果你能忍受这个味道，那么臭豆腐其实非常好吃。

segments.en: Example three.
segments.cn: 例子三。

segments.en: I've had to put up with him for too long.
segments.cn: 我已经忍受他太久了。

segments.en: I want a new roommate.
segments.cn: 我想要一个新室友。

segments.en: And after this, we've got another phrase, we're talking about beer.
segments.cn: 然后我们有另一个短语，我们在谈论啤酒。

segments.en: OK, and so the person says, oh, I have an idea.
segments.cn: 好的，这个人说，哦，我有个主意。

segments.en: Instead of bug spray, we can cover ourselves with beer.
segments.cn: 我们可以用啤酒来覆盖自己，而不是驱虫喷雾。

segments.en: So to cover yourself or cover ourselves.
segments.cn: 所以覆盖自己或覆盖我们自己。

segments.en: So it means that we put it all over us.
segments.cn: 这意味着我们把它涂满全身。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So you could even cover yourself with bug spray.
segments.cn: 所以你甚至可以用驱虫喷雾覆盖自己。

segments.en: OK, so every part of your body, you put bug spray on head to toe, head to toe.
segments.cn: 好的，你身体的每个部分，从头到脚涂上驱虫喷雾。

segments.en: Now you can cover yourself under a tree maybe, or you can cover yourself with a blanket.
segments.cn: 现在你可以在树下遮住自己，或者用毯子覆盖自己。

segments.en: OK, so to cover yourself to completely hide under something.
segments.cn: 好的，覆盖自己就是完全隐藏在某物下。

segments.en: And finally, we have the response to this idea, the answer.
segments.cn: 最后，我们有对这个主意的回应，答案。

segments.en: The person says, oh, without a doubt, that means absolutely or definitely.
segments.cn: 这个人说，哦，毫无疑问，这意味着绝对或肯定。

segments.en: OK, so there is no doubt it is true or it is certain.
segments.cn: 好的，所以毫无疑问这是真的或确定的。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So a doubt is something that maybe you're not so sure about.
segments.cn: 所以怀疑是你可能不太确定的事情。

segments.en: You're not convinced.
segments.cn: 你没有被说服。

segments.en: But you can say this is without a doubt the best mosquito spray.
segments.cn: 但你可以说这是毫无疑问的最佳驱虫喷雾。

segments.en: Or this is without a doubt the best cake I've ever eaten.
segments.cn: 或者这是我吃过的最好蛋糕。

segments.en: That means it's definitely the best cake I've ever eaten.
segments.cn: 这意味着它绝对是我吃过的最好蛋糕。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So I think we've covered all the phrases now.
segments.cn: 我认为我们现在已经涵盖了所有短语。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to our dialogue for the last time?
segments.cn: 我们为什么不最后听一次对话呢？

segments.en: And we'll be right back.
segments.cn: 我们马上回来。

segments.en: The mosquitoes are biting me.
segments.cn: 蚊子在咬我。

segments.en: Me too.
segments.cn: 我也是。

segments.en: I can't stop scratching.
segments.cn: 我停不下来抓。

segments.en: They're everywhere.
segments.cn: 它们无处不在。

segments.en: Sneaky little jerks.
segments.cn: 这些狡猾的小家伙。

segments.en: Do you have any bug spray?
segments.cn: 你有驱虫喷雾吗？

segments.en: No, I forgot to buy some.
segments.cn: 不，我忘了买。

segments.en: Then we'll have to put up with it.
segments.cn: 那我们就得忍受了。

segments.en: We can cover ourselves with beer.
segments.cn: 我们可以用啤酒覆盖自己。

segments.en: That way, if they bite us, they'll get drunk and fall asleep.
segments.cn: 这样，如果它们咬我们，它们会喝醉然后睡着。

segments.en: That's without doubt the best idea you've ever had.
segments.cn: 这无疑是你有过的最佳主意。

segments.en: Let's do it.
segments.cn: 我们来做吧。

segments.en: Run.
segments.cn: 跑！

segments.en: They're thirsty for more.
segments.cn: 它们渴望更多。

segments.en: Mosquitoes are very annoying, but at times they can be very dangerous, right?
segments.cn: 蚊子非常烦人，但有时它们也可能非常危险，对吗？

segments.en: They can.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: There are a couple of diseases that can be passed by mosquito bites.
segments.cn: 有几种疾病可以通过蚊子叮咬传播。

segments.en: One of them is malaria.
segments.cn: 其中一种是疟疾。

segments.en: And that's, I think, pretty common in Southeast Asia and South Asia.
segments.cn: 我认为这在东南亚和南亚相当常见。

segments.en: Now, there was another situation where people believe that if a mosquito bit a person infected with HIV or AIDS, they could pass it on to another person.
segments.cn: 现在，还有一种情况，人们相信如果蚊子叮咬了感染HIV或艾滋病的人，它们可以传给另一个人。

segments.en: Aha.
segments.cn: 啊哈。

segments.en: Well, I don't know that that's even possible because there's no AIDS carrying mosquitoes.
segments.cn: 嗯，我不知道这是否可能，因为没有携带艾滋病的蚊子。

segments.en: But there is another disease called dengue fever.
segments.cn: 但还有一种叫登革热的疾病。

segments.en: Dengue fever.
segments.cn: 登革热。

segments.en: And this is another very dangerous one.
segments.cn: 这也是一种非常危险的疾病。

segments.en: It's also known as break bone fever.
segments.cn: 也被称为骨痛热。

segments.en: And I think it's so painful, it feels like your bones are breaking.
segments.cn: 我认为它非常痛苦，感觉就像你的骨头在断裂。

segments.en: And that's where the name comes from.
segments.cn: 这就是名字的来源。

segments.en: It's very common in South America as well.
segments.cn: 在南美也很常见。

segments.en: And because we have such a tropical climate that in the rainforests of Brazil, Peru, Colombia, it's common to see this.
segments.cn: 而且因为我们有如此热带的气候，在巴西、秘鲁、哥伦比亚的雨林中，这种情况很常见。

segments.en: But not so much anymore now they're eradicating it.
segments.cn: 但现在不太常见了，他们正在消灭它。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So an interesting topic.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个有趣的话题。

segments.en: Mosquitoes are not only irritating, but can be dangerous.
segments.cn: 蚊子不仅令人恼火，而且可能是危险的。

segments.en: So if you have any other questions or doubts, please come to our website, EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 所以如果你有任何其他问题或疑虑，请访问我们的网站，EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: And we're there to answer any questions.
segments.cn: 我们会回答任何问题。

segments.en: So we'll see you on the website.
segments.cn: 所以我们在网站上见。

segments.en: And until next time, everyone, bye bye.
segments.cn: 下次见，大家，再见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。

segments.en: you.
segments.cn: 你。
